snippet: The government said its top intelligence agency had spied on diplomatic targets from countries including the United States, putting officials on the defensive.
abstract: Brazil's government acknowledges that its top intelligence agency had spied on diplomatic targets from countries including the United States, Iran and Russia, putting the Brazilian authorities in the uncomfortable position of defending their own surveillance practices after repeatedly criticizing American spying operations.
lead_paragraph: The government said its top intelligence agency had spied on diplomatic targets from countries including the United States, putting officials on the defensive.

headline.main: Brazil Says It Spied on U.S. and Others Inside Its Borders
headline.print_headline: Brazil Says It Spied on U.S. and Others Inside Its Borders
